column2: ART EDUCATION: FOUNDATIONS AND CONCEPTS ELEMENTARY
column4: 2.75 GPA and sophomore standing in art education.
column6: An introduction to art education concepts. Emphasis on child development and on teaching the expressive and responsive dimensions of art in the early grades. Eleven field clinical hours are associated with this course.
A teaching experience for applying art education concepts. Analysis of instructional problems emphasized. Fifty-four field and/or clinical hours are associated with this course.

column4: Permission of instructor.
column6: Special topics (experimental course).

column4: pecial approval.
column6: Additional study in areas of a student's choice in consultation with adviser.

column2: ART EDUCATION: FOUNDATIONS AND CONCEPTS SECONDARY
column4: 2.75 GPA and ARTE 31004.
column6: An examination of relationships between content, materials and strategies for teaching art to students in grades 7 12 and students with special needs. Nine field and or clinical hours are associated with this course.

column4: 2.75 GPA and ARTE 31004.
column6: A planning and teaching experience for teaching art in various settings; analysis of classroom situations emphasized. Fifty-four field and/or clinical hours are associated with this course.

column4: 2.75 GPA and pre- or corequisite ARTE 41002 and 41003.
column6: Examination of student's knowledge, proficiency and ability to apply concepts in art and art education.

column2: FIELD EXPERIENCE: TRAVEL STUDY IN ART EDUCATION
column4: Major in art education or special approval of instructor.
column6: Travel-based study/field experience in art education to and at a site or sites away from Kent State University.

column4: pecial approval.
column6: Additional study in areas of students' choice in consultation with adviser.

column2: ART EDUCATION: INQUIRY INTO PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE
column4: 2.75 GPA and ARTE 41009 and special approval.
column6: Concepts and practices related to teaching art. Inquiry into art teaching as a professional practice. Emphasis is on teacher as critical disciplined investigator. Twenty-six field and/or clinical hours are associated with this course.

column2: ART EDUCATION: STUDENT TEACHING AND SEMINAR
column4: 2.75 overall and major GPA and ARTE 41009.
column6: Provides a 10-week student teaching experience and associated seminar. See student teaching section in catalog.

column4: Graduate standing and special approval.
column6: An examination of relationships between content, materials and strategies for teaching art. Seven field and/or clinical hours are associated with this course.

column2: FIELD EXPERIENCE: TRAVEL STUDY IN ART EDUCATION
column4: Graduate standing in art education or special approval by instructor.
column6: Travel-based study/field experience in art education to and at a site or sites away from Kent State University.

column2: ART EDUCATION: INQUIRY INTO PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE
column4: Graduate standing and special approval.
column6: Concepts and practices related to teaching art. Inquiry into art teaching as a professional practice. Emphasis is on teacher as critical disciplined investigator. Twenty six field and/or clinical hours are associated with this course.

column4: ARTE 61198 and instructor's special approval; graduate standing.
column6: A course whose topic changes to reflect the interests and specialization's of faculty.

column4: ART 61001, 61003, 61198 and special approval. Graduate standing.
column6: Specialized study leading to the thesis in art education.

column4: Art Education (ARTE) majors; and graduate standing.
column6: Emphasizes the study of some prevailing themes in Pre K-12 Art and Design education. The curriculum focuses on the ideas of leading scholars and practicing teachers who have shaped practice in the field of art education within the context of the social, political, and educational values and beliefs of the time. Seminar II is a continuation of the topics addressed in Seminar I.

column4: ARTE 61001, 61003 and special approval. Graduate standing.
column6: Specialized research leading to the thesis in art education.

column4: ARTE 61198 and instructor's special permission; graduate standing.
column6: This comprehensive review is a formal assessment of students' knowledge and understanding of concepts in art, education and art education.

column4: ARTE 61191; and graduate standing.
column6: Following ARTE 61191, this course continues the study of some prevailing themes in Pre K-12 art and design education. The curriculum will focus on the ideas of leading scholars and practicing teachers who have shaped practice in the field of art education within the context of the social, political, and educational values and beliefs of the time.

column4: ARTE 61209 and instructor's special approval; graduate standing.
column6: A course for guiding the design, preparation of drafts and presentation of the terminal project in the non-thesis track of the MA program in art education.
